title: LONE WOLF - biker style display font - FONT ID
content:
Looking for an ID on the font used on this patch. Looks like a popular font used by bikers (Hells Angels, etc) on jackets and patches.

Any help would be greatly apprecaited.  
Many thanks in advance,  
Danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032243im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lonewolfpatch_5397.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [lonewolfpatch.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032243/http:/typophile.com/files/lonewolfpatch.jpg) | 53.24 KB |
author: Danny_Miller

comments.content:
Subject discussed in previous thread  
 [http://typophile.com/node/104210](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032243/http:/typophile.com/node/104210 "http://typophile.com/node/104210")  
AFAIK there is no current design patent on the design.  
In sum the lettering is a pretty generic rendition of some 19th century "Tuscan" designs with "median spurs" -- the pointy bulges on the sides of the vertical strokes. Google Tuscan and you will find plenty from which to choose.  
Discussion of another spurred font for jackets  
 [http://typophile.com/node/103278](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032243/http:/typophile.com/node/103278 "http://typophile.com/node/103278")  
Don

It's close but this one is not the same as the one for the Hells Angels. It's [Bosox](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310032243/http:/www.dafont.com/bosox.font) by Lee Gordon, most probably a digitization attempt of MLB Boston Red Sox jersey font.
